__e: "I heard you tell Rose that you loved me -- and I love you, too."
I loved her, and I killed her... because she was using what I told her.
She never loved me, and I knew that.
He's my boyfriend, and he told me last night that he loves me, and that he wants to come on this trip with me and my family.
I know how much you loved him and I know it will never be the same.
He said no, that he really did love me... and he was gonna make me a somebody.
It was "our love," not me that you loved.
He said no, that he really did love me... and he was gonna make me a somebody.
I know how much you loved him and I know it will never be the same.
I'm luckier than you 'cause I had a father, a wonderful father whom I loved dearly.
When you see my wife again, please tell her that I loved her fondly.
And he sees something in you that reminds him of his daughter, who he loved very much, but he lost her.
And loved him as much as a mother would love her son.
And your father loved him so that it was no trouble.
I assume that you loved your husband. Am I right?
I know how much you loved your father.
I too would have loved my baby.
It was being with other people that made me realize just how much I love my husband.
( playing sad melody ) I loved my mother, too.
It was you she loved all along.
I know how much you loved your father.
He gave me the acid test to see whether i loved him enough to give up all rights to his money, and then i realized it was you who provided the acid.
At first I loved you without knowing it.
That was before I knew I Loved you.
She didn't love you more than I do, but you loved her.
But beyond all, this man was in love with his wife.
He spent his entire leave telling me how much he loved his wife.
She doesn't love me like Papa did, and she didn't love him, either.
She loved life. I think she was killed, and I want you to look into it.
I don't think she would have married him.
